snippet: The official statistics say that the national economy has been growing for almost three years, but there is scant evidence of renewed prosperity in places like Prince George’s County, Md.
abstract: Official statistics show that the national economy has been growing for almost three years, but in places like Prince George’s County, Md, where housing prices have fallen more than anywhere else in the state, there is scant evidence of renewed prosperity; some economists argue that debt burden is so large that even a zero percent interest rate is not low enough to attract spending.
lead_paragraph: The official statistics say that the national economy has been growing for almost three years, but there is scant evidence of renewed prosperity in places like Prince George’s County, Md.

headline.main: Where Housing Once Boomed, Recovery Lags
headline.print_headline: Where Housing Once Boomed, Recovery Lags
